level.heading: Appropriations.
level.text: There is hereby authorized to be appropriated such District funds as may be necessary and available to implement the provisions of this chapter, including funds for the development, and the support, of community-based services for persons with intellectual disabilities.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 16-305 substituted "persons with mental retardation" for "mentally retarded persons".
The 2012 amendment by D.C. Law 19-169 substituted "intellectual disabilities" for "mental retardation" at the end.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 19-169
level.text: Law 19-169, the "People First Respectful Language Modernization Amendment Act of 2012," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 19-189. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on Mar. 6, 2012, and Apr. 17, 2012, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on May 15, 2012, it was assigned Act No. 19-361 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 19-169 became effective on Sept. 26, 2012.
